1.text: Jesus entered Jericho and was passing through town.

2.text: There was a man named Zacchaeus who was a chief tax collector, and he was rich.

3.text: He was trying to see who Jesus was, and could not because of the crowd, for he was short.

4.text: He ran on ahead and climbed up into a sycamore tree to see Jesus, who was [about] to pass that way.

5.text: When Jesus came to the place, he looked up, saw Zacchaeus, and said to him, “Zacchaeus, hurry and come down, for today I must stay at your house!”

6.text: He hurried, came down, and received Jesus with joy.

7.text: But when the people saw it, they all grumbled, saying, “He has gone in to stay with a man who is a sinner!”

8.text: Zacchaeus stood up and said to the Lord, “Behold, Lord, half of my goods I give to the poor. And if I have wrongfully obtained money from anyone, I restore four times as much!”

9.text: Then Jesus said to him, “Today, salvation has come to this house, because he, too, is a son of Abraham.

10.text: For the Son of Man came to seek and to save what was lost.”

11.text: As the people heard these things, Jesus went on to tell [them] a parable because he was near Jerusalem, and they supposed that the Kingdom of God would be revealed immediately.

12.text: He said therefore, “A certain nobleman went into a far country to receive a kingdom for himself, and then return.

13.text: So he called ten of his slaves, gave them ten mina coins, and told them, ‘Do business [with these] until I come.’

14.text: But his subjects hated him, and they sent a delegation after him to say: ‘We do not want this man to reign over us.’

15.text: It so happened that when he returned after receiving the kingdom, he commanded these slaves to whom he had given the money to be called to him, so that he might know what they had earned by conducting business.

16.text: The first came before him, saying: ‘Lord, your mina has made ten more minas!’

17.text: The king said to him, ‘Well done, you good slave! Because you were found faithful with very little, you shall have authority over ten cities.’

18.text: The second came, saying: ‘Your mina, Lord, has made five minas!’

19.text: And so, the king said to him, ‘And you are to be set over five cities.’

20.text: Another came, saying: ‘Lord, behold, [here is] your mina, which I kept laid away in a piece of cloth.

21.text: I was afraid of you, because you are a strict man! You take up what you did not lay down, and you reap what you did not sow, and gather where you did not scatter.’

22.text: The king said to him, ‘Out of your own mouth will I judge you, you wicked slave! You perceived that I was a severe man, taking up what I did not lay down, and reaping what I did not sow, and gathering where I did not scatter.

23.text: Why then did you not place my money on deposit, and at my coming, I would have collected it with interest on it?’

24.text: He then said to those who stood by, ‘Take the mina away from him, and give it to the one who has the ten minas.’

25.text: At this, they said to the master, ‘Lord, he [already] has ten minas!’

26.text: ‘For I tell you that to everyone who [already] has, more will be given; but from the one who does not have, even what he has will be taken away from him.

27.text: As for those enemies of mine who did not want me to reign over them, bring them here and kill them before me.’”

28.text: Having said these things, Jesus went on ahead, going up to Jerusalem.

29.text: And it so happened that when he approached Bethsphage and Bethany, at the mountain that is called Olivet, he sent two of his disciples,

30.text: saying, “Go your way into the village on the other side. There, as you enter, you will find a colt tied up, on which no one has ever sat. Untie it, and bring it.

31.text: If anyone asks you, ‘Why are you untying it?’ reply, ‘The Lord needs it!’”

32.text: Those who were sent went away and found the colt standing just as Jesus had told them.

33.text: As they were untying the colt, its owners asked them, “Why are you untying the colt?”

35.text: They brought it to Jesus, and having thrown their cloaks on the colt, they set Jesus on [it].

36.text: As he went, they [also] spread their cloaks in the way.

37.text: As Jesus was now approaching, at the descent of the Mount of Olives, the whole multitude of the disciples began to rejoice and praise God with a loud voice for all the deeds of power which they had seen.

38.text: [They were] saying, “Blessed is he who is coming, a King in the Name of the Lord! Peace in heaven, and glory in the highest!”

39.text: And from the multitude, some of the Pharisees said to Jesus, “Teacher, rebuke your disciples!”

40.text: But he answered them, “I tell you that if these were silent, the stones would cry out!”

41.text: As Jesus was drawing near, he saw the city and began to weep over it,

42.text: saying, “If you, even you, had today recognized what is for your peace! But now those things are hidden from your eyes!

43.text: For the days will come upon you when your enemies will throw up a fortification around you, surround you, and hem you in on every side.

44.text: They will crush you and your children within you to the ground. They will not leave in you one stone [standing] on another, because you did not know the time of your visitation.”

45.text: Then Jesus entered into the temple, and he began to drive out those who bought and sold in it,

46.text: saying to them, “It is written that my house is a house of prayer, but you have made it a den of robbers!”

47.text: He was teaching every day in the temple, but the chief priests, the scribes and the leading men among the people were looking for a way to destroy him.

48.text: However, they could not find a way to do so because all the people were captured by every word that he said.
